meanings.definition: A person who stirs up or promotes trouble or discord.
meanings.sent1: The fomenter in the group always started arguments.
meanings.sent2: The troublemaker was known as a fomenter among his friends.
meanings.sent3: The fomenter's antics often led to chaos and disagreements.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as a fomenter, sparking conflicts wherever she went.
meanings.sent5: Beware of the fomenter, for they thrive on creating unrest.

meanings.definition: To instigate or encourage (discord, rebellion, etc.).
meanings.sent1: He tried to fomenter a rebellion against the unjust ruler.
meanings.sent2: The group leader warned against fomenting unnecessary arguments.
meanings.sent3: She jokingly said she would fomenter a pillow fight at the sleepover.
meanings.sent4: His speech acted as a fomenter, rousing the crowd to action.
meanings.sent5: The politician's words were like a match, fomenting unrest in the city.

meanings.sent1: The chef had to fomenter the sauce to prevent it from burning.
meanings.sent2: The protestors planned to foment a peaceful demonstration.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to fomenter a plan to surprise their parents.
meanings.sent4: The wind began to foment the waves, creating a storm at sea.
meanings.sent5: His actions seemed to foment trouble wherever he went.
